intro: Astragalus hypoglottis var. tschujensis, commonly known as the Tschujen milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-white flowers clustered in globular heads. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval leaflets and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, known for its nitrogen-fixing ability through symbiotic bacteria in its root nodules. This variety is often found in rocky soils and is of interest for its potential ecological and medicinal uses.
